alert.note: Alert for Clark (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 11 at 10:31PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...Snow Continues to Move Across the Area... Snow will continue to move eastward across the area through late evening. The snow will be moderate to briefly heavy, as well as mixed with rain at times. The snow will lead to reduced visibilities down to a mile, and slippery travel conditions especially on bridges and overpasses. In areas of lighter snow and rain, the pavement should stay mainly wet. Additional snowfall accumulations of up to 1 inch will be possible through midnight. After the snow decreases later tonight, areas of fog may form and linger into early Sunday morning. Some of this fog may become dense, reducing visibility down to a quarter mile or less. Use caution and utilize winter driving skills if traveling tonight. Please drive slowly and allow extra time to reach your destination.
